body:
Comment 3: 
I was under the impression that 'go run' was the official shortcut for running programs
without explicitly installing them (i.e building, running and cleaning up in a temp dir
somewhere).

Given quite a few of the other commands easily figures out complex projects by their own
(some with no arguments, others the './...' magic path), I would expect 'go run' to do
the same. Explicitly crippling 'go run' in this way doesn't feel intuitive to me.

And a final quirk - if I move the extra files into a separate module, and thus makes the
project as a whole more complex (having to export/import the right parts), 'go run'
suddenly works. This seem quite contrary to the argument made.
